intro: Diplolaena dampieri, commonly known as the Northern Territory saltbush, is a shrub native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. Diplolaena dampieri is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
